requirement.topic: XmlBlaster has an advanced queuing facility. Among others one tested persistence layer is offered by communicating with an oracle database.

description.p: The generic plugin for jdbc based queues has been tested against Oracle 9.20 i on linux).
Oracle is available on http://www.oracle.com where you can find all necessary information and instructions on how to make Oracle run.

Once you have a running oracle database you can configure xmlBlaster to make it run against it. Before you need to download the jdbc driver (you need two files: the classes12.zip nls_charset12.zip files which you can download them from http://otn.oracle.com/software/tech/java/sqlj_jdbc/content.html. You must put these files in the CLASSPATH (for example you can put them into $XMLBLASTER_HOME/lib and add them to the CLASSPATH.

requirement.example:
These are example QoS of subscribe() invocations:
<qos> <queue maxMsgCache='1000' maxBytesCache='4000' maxMsg='10000' maxBytes='1000000000' onOverflow='deadMessage'/> </qos>
requirement.configuration:
These parameters allow to configure a cache queue running with postgres
Property Default Description Hot Impl
QueuePlugin[CACHE][1.0] org.xmlBlaster.util.queue.cache.CacheQueueInterceptorPlugin specifies the cache implementing class to be used
queue.maxMsg 1000 specifies the maximum number of entries allowed in this queue
queue.maxBytes 10485760 (10MB) specifies the maximum total size allowed in this queue
queue.persistent.url jdbc:oracle:thin:@develop:1521:TEST the url which specifies where to find the DB.
queue.persistent.user xmlblaster The db user under which to run
queue.persistent.password secret The password used together with the user 'xmlblaster'
Additionally the configuration parameters for the ram queue and the jdbc queue must be defined.
